title: Extend existing learning module with stress vs. distress content and a guided reflection prompt

requirements.summary: Extend an existing module in modules.ts with new stress vs. distress (eustress vs. distress) learning content without creating a new module.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/content/modules.ts` is updated to extend (not add) at least one existing `Module` entry by adding new `content` items focused on stress vs. distress.
No new `Module` object is added to `MODULES`; changes are limited to adding content to an existing module.
All added user-facing text is in English.

file_operations.description: Choose one existing Module entry (do not add a new module) and append new `content` items that define and contrast stress vs. distress (including eustress vs. distress), with practical framing and examples (e.g., training stress, time pressure, sleep debt, conflict). Keep all user-facing text in English.

requirements.summary: Add paraphrased, attribution-style insights and general summaries inspired by specified public high-performance figures, plus explanatory sections on stress vs. distress.
acceptanceCriteria: The updated module content includes items that reference each specified figure by name with paraphrased/attribution-style insights (no long verbatim quotes).
The content also includes general explanatory sections defining and contrasting stress vs. distress (including practical framing and examples).
No backend changes are required to render the new content; the Modules page continues to render from `MODULES` without runtime errors.

file_operations.description: Within the same chosen existing module, add a mix of (a) short attribution-style quote items and (b) interpretation/summary items. Ensure each of the following figures is referenced by name at least once using paraphrased attribution language (e.g., 'Inspired by …'): Wim Hof, David Goggins, Shawn Ryan, Joe Rogan, Tom Brady, Michael Jordan, Mike Tyson, Jocko Willink. Avoid copyrighted or unverifiable verbatim quotes; keep statements short, paraphrased, and framed as inspiration. Also include general explanatory content that clarifies eustress vs. distress and how to reframe/manage stress.

requirements.summary: Add at least one new module reflection prompt that starts a guided journal entry with stress-vs-distress tailored prefill title and content.
acceptanceCriteria: The chosen existing module’s `prompts` array includes at least one new prompt related to stress vs. distress.
Clicking “Start” on the new prompt in `frontend/src/pages/Modules.tsx` navigates to `/journal` with `prefillTitle` and `prefillContent` populated (via the existing search params behavior).
The prefill template includes structured questions/checklist items that help the user identify stressors, distinguish eustress vs. distress, and choose an action + recovery plan.

file_operations.description: In the same chosen existing module, add at least one new `prompts` item with `prefillTitle` and `prefillContent` tailored to applying stress-vs-distress concepts and influencer-inspired practices. The prefill should include structured questions/checklist sections that: (1) identify current stressors and triggers, (2) classify each as eustress vs. distress with rationale, (3) pick one action to convert distress to manageable stress (or reduce load), and (4) define a recovery plan (sleep, breathwork, training load, boundaries, support).

Confirm the reflection prompt 'Start' action continues to navigate to `/journal` with `prefillTitle` and `prefillContent` in search params for the newly added prompt, and that the module renders without errors after content/prompt additions.
